intro: Aquilegia vestinae, commonly known as the Vestinae Columbine, is a perennial flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, often toxic flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and clusters of bright blue or purple flowers. Its foliage consists of deeply lobed, trifoliate leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silky hair. Aquilegia vestinae thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
